reviews.review_msg: Created a podcast with her husband that covers all the most important concepts in layman terms. Makes upper-division content easy to understand--you can tell that she really knows her stuff. Uses mastery quizzes. Course built around actually learning the content rather than just memorizing. Would absolutely take again.

Really enjoyed taking this class with Dr. Girme. She made the material clear and engaging. Probably the easiest PSYC course you could take at SFU (our class avergae was A-). The mastery quizzes were straightforward. Just make sure to listen to the podcasts each week before the quiz!!

Dr Girme is the one of the best profs. Her lectures are amazing! Mastery learning isn't for everyone but I loved it. I learned a lot and the effort I put in turned into good results. The other assignments are a fair bit of work but they aren't worth a lot so it's ok if you don't do amazing on all of them.

This woman changed my life. Her mere presence is inspiring, she is so passionate about what she does, and it shows in her lectures. Tas are tough graders, but Yuthikas mastery grading makes it all worth it. It seems scary, but with 3 chances to excel per module, you are bound to succeed. I honestly wish all professors did that.

Very engaging lectures. Mastery learning is approachable and effective. Easily the most information I've retained out of any class I've taken. Fun group project and interactive discussions between classmates. I would highly recommend anyone to take her class and I hope mastery learning is more widespread in SFU in the near future.

Amazing professor, very responsive and kind. She's funny and engaging- her lectures are awesome. She's very knowledgeable and teaches well. Her assignments are reasonable but the final had lots of trick questions.

I found this prof to be sort of creepy and overly touchy with me when I asked her to clarify a concept once before class. Just unprofessional and made me uncomfortable. Aside from that though her mastery grading isn't that difficult. You will do well if you just put in some effort towards studying as quizzes are the bulk of your grade.

Although daunting, mastery grading is not as hard as it's made out to be. 
Yuthika is a phenomenal proff and I very much enjoyed 362. I'd highly recommend 362 for all psyc majors.
My one issue with 362 was that one particular TA, was a very harsh grader and gave odd feedback. I know at least 6 people in the class who had the same opinion, bizzare

Mastery quizzes are not hard. Other assignments, while a fair bit of work, are not worth very much so it doesn't matter if you do badly on one of them. I loved the grading scheme, if you put in the effort you will get an A. Her lectures were engaging and interesting and overall she cared a lot about her students. I would definitely recommend.

I don't get the hype about Dr Girme. While she portrays herself as caring and attentive, her interactions with students felt superficial and insincere. I didn't learn anything new and her mastery quizzes were not helpful for learning.

She is a great prof and enjoyed lectures. I didnt like her grading scale (you need 10/12, 11/12 for partial to full marks). Each mastery quiz is worth 7% but a 2500 word paper is worth 10%? Lastly I wish she laid her ground rules for mastery quizzes cause she had to change the whole final exam cause people took pictures. I still recommend though

Yuthika is a lovely prof, very passionate. But her grading is absolutely atrocious. You have 3 tries to "master" her quizzes (which means you are only allowed to make 1 mistake or you'll get a grade of 0). My TA was a tough grader for no reason. Overall, TAKE THE QUIZZES SERIOUSLY! nothing else matters in the class tbh.

I don't find her mastery quizzes useful or helpful for our learning. You get 3 tries on the quizzes. If you do bad on the first quiz, no problem! Just memorize the answer because 60% of the questions are from the first quiz. If you get 10/12, that's 50% and 11/12 or 12/12 is 100%. I don't like her grading scale

A kind prof, not a time-consuming class most of the time. Assignments are pretty open-ended which can be confusing (fuzzy guidelines), but she's helpful in office hours. Does mastery quizzes, which weren't hard if you reviewed a bit beforehand. Gives an opportunity for extra credit for about 15 students in the class too (based on a group project).
Easy A. Shes a great prof, just attend lectures and you will do well. She gives you 3 chances to do each quiz which makes it really easy to achieve high grades

I cannot say more good things about Dr. Girme!! She is by far the most caring and understanding prof I have ever had. I go out of my way to take any and every class she teaches every semester! She is fair, approachable, kind, respectful of your time and opinions and is very knowledgeable about her courses! If you get the chance, take her classes!
I don't understand the hype about Professor Grime because honestly you don't learn anything new in her classes.

Yuthika is my favorite professor at SFU! Her lectures were REALLY interesting and really well explained. The final exam was really fair and not too hard at all. I really want to take another class with her again!
I mean this is the prof that you want to always study with. Enroll in her courses, you learn a lot and get good grades.
Best psychology prof ever met, caring for students and the mastery grading is a masterpiece. Study well and it would be an A.
Really really amazing prof! I would def recommend taking one of her classes if you have a chance! A true gem, if you have any questions feel free to ask her!

AMAZING! Nicest, kindest, professor I ever had. Her classes are engaging and tied to relevant events in society. She is very quick to reply to emails and is very nice to chat with. Her grading is fair and she is more concerned with teaching you than curving the class to the typical B average. In her class, everyone has a chance for an A.

Hands down best prof I've ever had. She makes a podcast for the course content every week that makes learning the material fun. She gives you three attempts at quizzes to master them, which makes up 60% of your grade. Her teaching style really sets you up to succeed as the class average was in the A range.

Yuthika was one of my all time favourite profs. I took her course remotely and she created podcasts called Merlot with my Beau with her husband Steve. They were really engaging and featured other distinguished professors from around the world. Course evaluation was mainly quizzes and discussions on Canvas. She was very accommodating despite covid
Her lecture is very interesting and makes the content easy to understand !!
Hands down best professor at SFU. she genuinely cares about your progress and success in the class. Also HILARIOUS.

Even though I didn't get the best grade (probably due to the pandemic), Professor Grime's relationship course is definitely one you should take (either as an elective or for psychology credits). All the concepts will be from the slides, though you'll need to read articles as they will appear on the test. The lectures are fun and full of activities

Dr. Grime is one of the best profs I have ever had. Her lectures are fun and enjoyable and the content presented is very clear. Her lecture 'quizzes' are all opinion-based, and you only have to go to 10 lectures to receive full credit. Must do the readings as it will be on the midterm/final exam. Overall, an amazing prof.

Yuthika is an amazing professor! Her class is actually really interesting if you're especially interested in social psychology and relationships! I'm hoping in the future she will teach more classes because I would take another class with her.

Took Close Relationships and Individual Differences with her after having her guest lecture one of my PSYC300W lectures. 100% made the right choice. Shes so funny, so real, really connects with her students, super understanding and makes lectures fun! Tests are easy if you study her slides (which have everything on them!). Take her class

I took Psyc 391 & 362 with Girme. She is super fun and obviously puts lots of effort into her lectures. Lecture slides are well organized and clear, and readings are available online, and usually somewhat covered in class. Exams are hard, must know diagrams from slides in detail. Class participation is mandatory, iclicker ?'s every class.

Yuthika herself is a great lecturer and we learned useful life-changing information but damn was this class hard. Short answers were impossible because you have to memorize the diagrams WORD FOR WORD. Paper was vague and graded harshly. 60% Average for midterm and class was not scaled up.
Dr. Girme is an awesome prof, and the class is super interesting. She has a great sense of humor, does a great job of explaining theories and contextualizing everything. Highly recommend!

Yuthika is the best prof I've ever taken a class with. I found myself going to lecture because I actually enjoyed the way she presented the material, and not just to get participation marks. Her tests are based solely on the lecture notes, so make sure you're clear on the concepts in lecture & you'll do amazing on the midterm and final.
Yuthika is an amazing prof and her lectures are very interesting and engaging.

Dr. Girme is a great lecturer, the class project is engaging and the tests are relatively challenging, but reasonable if you pay attention in class and do the readings. I would strongly recommend taking PSYC362!
I really enjoyed Yuthika's teaching, and the course was really interesting and not hard at all if you go to class. Highly recommend!

Had her for relationship psychology. Amazing prof who's considerate and genuine and funny. Her exams are pretty simple as long as you read all the slides and attend lectures. Is very clear and concise in her teaching as well.

Yuthika was an amazing prof! She's probably one of the best lecturer's I have ever had at SFU and her content is extremely clear and concise. She also makes the lectures super interesting and is funny as hell. She's also super helpful when certain concepts are not well understand. Overall, she's dope.
